summaries.brief_summary: New outline command option merged, ongoing work on syntax hovers and performance fixes
summaries.new_features_summary: Added `-include-types` flag to outline command allowing LSP to control type information display
summaries.new_features: - Added **`-include-types` flag** to outline command allowing control over type information display in output, enabling LSP to use Merlin's outline query directly rather than ad-hoc implementations ([#183](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/183))
summaries.activity_summary: Active development on syntax documentation and performance optimization with detailed review discussions

- **Short-paths performance optimization** addressing exponential algorithm causing 40+ minute delays in Jane Street codebase, with detailed technical discussion on implementation approaches ([#182](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/182))
summaries.discussions_summary: Technical discussions on implementation approaches for performance fixes and code review feedback

- **Merged OCaml 5.2.0minus-18 compiler changes** including typing system improvements, pattern matching enhancements, and updated magic numbers ([#180](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/180))

summaries.activity:

- **Compiler compatibility update** merging OCaml 5.2.0minus-18 changes affecting 70 files with 1008 additions and 611 deletions across typing, pattern matching, and analysis modules ([#180](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/180))
summaries.contributors_summary: Liam Stevenson contributed both PRs, improving tooling infrastructure and maintaining compiler compatibility

summaries.brief_summary: PPX override system implementation and major Flambda compiler merge bringing new type system features
summaries.new_features_summary: New PPX override system for document/locate commands and Flambda 5.2.0minus-17 type system enhancements
summaries.new_features:
- **PPX override system** with `@@@merlin.document` and `@@@merlin.locate` floating attributes allowing PPX-expanded files to override Merlin command outputs ([#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177))
- **Interval tree implementation** for efficient querying of override mappings with caching support using Phase_cache ([#176](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/176))
- **Enhanced type system features** from Flambda 5.2.0minus-17 merge including new scalar types module, extended jkind system, and mode analysis improvements ([#178](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/178))
- **New magic numbers** and compiler flag support for updated Flambda integration ([#174](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/174), [#175](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/175))
summaries.activity_summary: Completion of PPX override architecture with comprehensive testing and multiple Flambda compiler synchronization PRs
summaries.activity:
- **PPX override architecture completion** by [Max Wang](https://github.com/maxmwang) with interval tree caching using GADTs and Phase_cache integration, including server-mode tests for cache hit tracking ([#176](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/176))
- **Comprehensive override testing** including 915 lines of unified tests for document/locate functionality and unit tests for interval tree implementation ([#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177))
- **Flambda compiler synchronization** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) through multiple merge PRs bringing upstream changes from 5.2.0minus-16 retag operations ([#174](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/174), [#175](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/175))
- **Large-scale compiler integration** with 31,372 additions and 23,609 deletions across 178 files including new scalar type system and enhanced uniqueness analysis ([#178](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/178))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on PPX ecosystem integration and keeping pace with upstream Flambda compiler developments
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **PPX ecosystem integration** with new override mechanisms enabling PPX tools to provide custom behavior for Merlin commands, particularly useful for code generation scenarios
- **Performance-conscious caching strategies** using interval trees and Phase_cache for efficient override lookup in large codebases with extensive PPX usage
- **Systematic upstream synchronization** with regular Flambda compiler merges to maintain compatibility with cutting-edge OCaml type system features
- **Comprehensive testing infrastructure** development with both unified and unit test coverage for new functionality
summaries.contributors_summary: Two contributors delivered PPX override system and compiler synchronization work with collaborative development approach
summaries.contributors:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) led the Flambda compiler integration efforts with multiple merge PRs ([#174](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/174), [#175](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/175), [#178](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/178)) and facilitated [Max Wang](https://github.com/maxmwang)'s PPX improvements contribution by creating PR [#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177) on his behalf
- [Max Wang](https://github.com/maxmwang) implemented the core PPX override system functionality including interval tree design, caching architecture, and comprehensive testing infrastructure ([#176](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/176), authored [#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177))

summaries.brief_summary: Major OxCaml 5.2.0minus-16 merge and PPX overrides system development for enhanced Merlin functionality
summaries.new_features_summary: New Let_mutable language extension and updated magic numbers for OxCaml 5.2.0minus-16 compatibility
summaries.new_features:
- **Let_mutable language extension** added to support mutable let bindings ([a4a79a1c](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/a4a79a1c5ce973f6bf9af81a30949cf09e6c7883))
- **Updated magic numbers** and compiler interface to support OxCaml version 5.2.0minus-16 with new Cmi magic number "Caml1999I565" ([#172](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/172))
summaries.activity_summary: PPX overrides system development with interval tree optimization and enhanced caching mechanisms
summaries.activity:
- **PPX overrides framework** implementation by [Max Wang](https://github.com/maxmwang) providing flexible command output overrides through `[@@@merlin.X]` floating attributes, supporting `document` and `locate` commands ([#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177), [#171](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/171))
- **Interval tree data structure** replacing linear list for efficient override querying by [Max Wang](https://github.com/maxmwang) with comprehensive unit tests and edge case coverage ([#173](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/173))
- **Performance optimization** through Phase_cache integration and GADT refactoring for overrides interval trees with lazy evaluation and cache hit tracking ([#176](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/176))
- **OxCaml compiler integration** merge by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) bringing extensive typing system changes, new shape analysis modules, and Vicuna value shapes functionality ([#172](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/172))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on PPX extensibility and compiler backend synchronization with performance-oriented data structure improvements
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **PPX integration enhancement** with structured override system enabling fine-grained control over Merlin command outputs for preprocessor-expanded code ([#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177), [#171](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/171), [#176](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/176), [#173](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/173))
- **Performance optimization through specialized data structures** with interval trees replacing linear searches and advanced caching mechanisms for better scalability ([#173](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/173), [#176](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/176))
- **Upstream compiler synchronization** maintaining compatibility with latest OxCaml developments including new language extensions and typing system improvements ([#172](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/172))
summaries.contributors_summary: Two core contributors driving PPX overrides development and compiler synchronization efforts
summaries.contributors:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) merged OxCaml 5.2.0minus-16 changes ([#172](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/172)) and coordinated PPX improvements merge ([#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177)) while providing review coordination and merge management
- [Max Wang](https://github.com/maxmwang) architected the complete PPX overrides system including interval tree implementation ([#173](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/173)), locate command support ([#171](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/171)), and caching optimization ([#176](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/176)) with comprehensive testing coverage

summaries.brief_summary: PPX support for merlin document and locate commands merged, plus improvements to test coverage for jkind printing

- **PPX locate support** adds `[@@@merlin.locate]` attribute parsing and abstractions for all `[@@@merlin]` override attributes by [Max Wang](https://github.com/maxmwang) ([#171](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/171))
- **Enhanced test coverage** for jkind printing with regression tests for type definitions like `type t = u = ...` by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#169](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/169))

summaries.brief_summary: Merlin receives completion order improvements and major project-wide renaming functionality
summaries.new_features_summary: Improved completion prioritization for expressions and added initial project-wide renaming support
summaries.new_features:
- **Completion order improvement** for expressions - modules now prioritized over types when completing in expression contexts ([#157](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/157))
- **Project-wide renaming** initial support added - occurrences can now return all usages of all related definitions with improved index file format ([f800beb](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/f800beb8b7040141003c31ffd969277857cbf47e))
- **Locate behavior improvements** using new OCaml 5.3 features - Merlin no longer confuses uids from interfaces and implementations ([f800beb](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/f800beb8b7040141003c31ffd969277857cbf47e))
- **Occurrences bug fix** for definitions from hidden source files now working correctly ([f800beb](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/f800beb8b7040141003c31ffd969277857cbf47e))
- **Test stability improvement** - flaky parameters tests fixed by implementing proper dune lock handling ([#166](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/166))
summaries.activity_summary: CI workflow improvements and substantial internal refactoring for renaming features
summaries.activity:
- **CI infrastructure enhancements** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) including workflow dispatch trigger and pull request workflow improvements for better fork PR support ([#164](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/164), [#165](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/165))
- **Index format refactoring** with new granular data structures including granular maps, sets, and marshalling for improved lazy reading capabilities ([f800beb](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/f800beb8b7040141003c31ffd969277857cbf47e))
- **Comprehensive test additions** for completion prioritization, occurrences handling, and project-wide functionality with extensive test coverage improvements ([#157](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/157), [f800beb](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/f800beb8b7040141003c31ffd969277857cbf47e))
- **Protocol documentation updates** reflecting new capabilities and API changes ([f800beb](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/f800beb8b7040141003c31ffd969277857cbf47e))

summaries.brief_summary: Merged OCaml 5.2.0minus-8 compiler updates with major type system enhancements and parser improvements
summaries.new_features_summary: Enhanced jkind type system with modalities, improved mode annotations, and updated magic numbers for AST compatibility
summaries.new_features:
- **Enhanced jkind type system** with new `modalities` parameter in `With` annotations, enabling more precise type constraints ([#136](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/136))
- **Improved mode lattice operations** with inline optimizations for performance in `Global`, `Regional`, and `Local` mode computations ([#136](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/136))
- **Updated magic numbers** from 557 to 558 for `cmi`, `ast_intf`, `ast_impl`, `cmt`, `cms`, and `index` files, ensuring compatibility with OCaml 5.2.0minus-8 ([#136](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/136))
- **Extended TypeHash interface** with new `replace` function for more flexible type expression hash table operations ([#136](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/136))
- **Parser enhancements** including `maybe_stack` wrapper for function expressions and removal of standalone `STACK` token support ([#136](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/136))
summaries.activity_summary: Single comprehensive merge integrating upstream OCaml compiler changes across 136 files with extensive typing and parsing updates
summaries.activity:
- **Upstream synchronization** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) merging OCaml flambda-backend changes from commit `9af08951` to `dc108ccc`, bringing Merlin up to date with OCaml 5.2.0minus-8 ([#136](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/136))
- **Comprehensive type system updates** across typing modules including `jkind.ml`, `mode.ml`, `ctype.ml`, and `types.ml` with enhanced support for modes and kinds ([#136](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/136))
- **Parser regeneration** with updated `parser_raw.ml` and `parser_recover.ml` files totaling over 63,000 lines of changes ([#136](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/136))
- **Test suite updates** including promoted test outputs and version number updates to reflect new magic numbers and type system capabilities ([#136](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/136))
summaries.trends_summary: Regular synchronization pattern with upstream OCaml compiler development through systematic merge processes
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Continuous upstream integration** showing the project's commitment to staying current with OCaml compiler development through regular merge cycles
- **Type system evolution** with ongoing enhancements to jkinds, modes, and modalities reflecting OCaml's advanced type system features
- **Automated conflict resolution** demonstrating mature merge processes for handling large-scale upstream changes
summaries.contributors_summary: Single contributor handled complex upstream merge with extensive conflict resolution and testing
summaries.contributors: - [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) performed the comprehensive merge of OCaml 5.2.0minus-8 changes, handling import of upstream sources, resolving merge conflicts across typing and parsing modules, fixing build errors, updating magic numbers, and promoting test cases ([#136](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/136))

summaries.brief_summary: Implementation of `-parameter` flag support for parameterized modules and typed hole module migration
summaries.new_features_summary: Added `-parameter` flag support for parameterized modules and migrated typed_hole module from ocaml-lsp
summaries.new_features:
- **Parameterized module support** through new `-parameter` flag implementation by [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer), enabling proper editing of parameterized modules without typechecking errors ([#128](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/128))
- **Typed hole module** migration from ocaml-lsp by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), providing `typed_hole.ml` and `typed_hole.mli` with functions for detecting and working with typed holes ([#129](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/129))
- **Instance name handling fix** in `Persistent_env` by [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer), removing unsupported instance name fatal error ([#127](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/127))
summaries.activity_summary: Focused development on parameterized module support with comprehensive test coverage
summaries.activity:
- **Parameterized module infrastructure** completed by [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) including core flag processing in `mconfig.ml`, `mocaml.ml`, and `mtyper.ml` with extensive test suite covering basic and advanced parameterized module scenarios ([#128](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/128))
- **Code synchronization efforts** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) to reduce diff with upstream merlin by migrating the typed_hole module that was previously in ocaml-lsp ([#129](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/129))
- **Bug fix recovery** by [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) restoring changes that were inadvertently dropped during a merge from oxcaml/oxcaml#1726 ([#127](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/127))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on parameterized module functionality and upstream synchronization
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Parameterized module support expansion** with the implementation of the `-parameter` flag representing substantial progress toward full parameterized module editing capabilities in Merlin
- **Upstream alignment initiatives** as demonstrated by the typed_hole module migration, indicating ongoing efforts to maintain compatibility with upstream merlin changes
- **Comprehensive testing approach** with extensive test coverage for new parameterized module functionality including basic usage, fancy scenarios, and reexported modules
summaries.contributors_summary: Two contributors implemented parameterized module support and performed upstream synchronization
summaries.contributors:
- [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) implemented the `-parameter` flag support for parameterized modules ([#128](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/128)) and fixed instance name handling in `Persistent_env` ([#127](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/127)), including comprehensive test suite development
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) migrated the typed_hole module from ocaml-lsp to reduce diff with upstream merlin ([#129](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/129)) and provided code review feedback on the parameterized module implementation
